pr_title: feat: adding utility to transform protobuf into model object

timeline.message:
feat: adding utility to transform protobuf into model object

With this commit, User shall be able to transform protobuf object to bigtable client's specific model objects.

timeline.author: igorbernstein2

replies.bodyText: Also please add a warning that the mutations should be idempotent (ie should not use server timestamps) because the mutations will be retried
replies.author: igorbernstein2

replies.bodyText: Also, lets mark this as BetaApi, in case this doesn't prove useful
replies.author: igorbernstein2

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the review, I have updated the JavaDoc with the same information. PTAL
replies.author: rahulKQL

timeline.bodyText: Same notes as BulkMutation, but you dont need to comment about idempotency this rpc is not retried
timeline.author: igorbernstein2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -136,4 +136,19 @@ public CheckAndMutateRowRequest toProto(RequestContext requestContext) { .setAppProfileId(requestContext.getAppProfileId()) .build(); } + + /** + * Wraps the protobuf {@link CheckAndMutateRowRequest}. + * + *

WARNING: Please note that the project id & instance id in the table name will be overwritten + * by the configuration in the BigtableDataClient. + */

timeline.author: igorbernstein2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -137,4 +137,19 @@ public ReadModifyWriteRowRequest toProto(RequestContext requestContext) { .setAppProfileId(requestContext.getAppProfileId()) .build(); } + + /** + * Wraps the protobuf {@link ReadModifyWriteRowRequest}. + * + *

WARNING: Please note that the project id & instance id in the table name will be overwritten + * by the configuration in the BigtableDataClient. + */

timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText: I dont think we need this...its only used by BulkMutation and if someone is using BulkMutation, they are already using the models
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.message:
chore: addressed feedback comments

 - updated the JavaDoc
 - marked the utility as `@BetaApi`

timeline.bodyText: Here and everywhere else, please stay consistent with existing fromProto methods
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText:
This javadoc is not quite right. Please rephrase to: Constructs a row mutation from an existing protobuf object.

Callers must ensure that the protobuf argument is not using serverside timestamps. The client assumes that all mutations are idempotent and will retry in case of transient errors. This can lead to row duplication.

When applied, the resulting Mutation object will ignore the project id and instance id in the table_name and instead apply the configuration in the client
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

replies.bodyText: Actually nevermind, please remove this fromProto method altogether. This object is not a top level model so from proto is not needed here
replies.author: igorbernstein2

replies.bodyText: It seems we need this utility for RowMutation#fromProto. At present, there is no other option to create model.Mutation from List of proto com.google.bigtable.v2.Mutation.
replies.author: rahulKQL

replies.bodyText: ok, can it be package private? or internalapi?
replies.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText:
Please replace with: Wraps the protobuf {@link MutateRowRequest}.

This is meant for advanced usage only. Please ensure that the MutateRowRequest does not use server side timestamps. The BigtableDataClient assumes that RowMutations are idempotent and is configured to enable retries by default. If serverside timestamps are enabled, this can lead to duplicate mutations

WARNING: Please note that the table name will be overwritten by the configuration in the * BigtableDataClient.
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText: The mutation must always be idempotent because it would be retried. needs to be explained more, please add a similar warning as described below for RowMutation.
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.message:
chore: addressed feedback comments

 - Rephrased Javadoc to include more explanation
 - change `Mutation#fromProto` visibility to package only

timeline.bodyText: Why is this visible for testing? I thought it was needed by RowMutation?
timeline.author: igorbernstein2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -87,6 +88,23 @@ public static Mutation fromProtoUnsafe(List pro return mutation; } + /** + * Constructs a row mutation from an existing protobuf object. + * + *

Callers must ensure that the protobuf argument is not using serverside timestamps. The + * client assumes that all mutations are idempotent and will retry in case of transient errors. + * This can lead to row duplication. + * + *

When applied, the resulting Mutation object will ignore the project id and instance id in + * the table_name and instead apply the configuration in the client + */ + @VisibleForTesting

replies.bodyText: This was my overlook, I have removed the unneeded annotation. PTAL
replies.author: rahulKQL

timeline.message:
chore: removed VisibleForTesting annotation

As Mutation#fromProto is being used by RowMutation#fromProto, So removed `@VisibleForTesting` annotation
chore: extended unit tests to verify project and instance override
